forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 57. West southwest wind 7 to 13 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 70, with temperatures falling to around 67 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 12 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph.

weather_report:
Tonight in Downtown San Francisco, the air settles into a false stillness, flirting with slight chills as dusk encroaches, promising a mild low of around fifty-seven degrees. The low west-southwest winds whisper through the streets, caressing the city with a gentle touch. Under a mostly clear sky, the stars will soon begin to sprinkle the expanse, offering a serene tableau for those who find themselves wandering the urban landscape this evening.

As we turn our gaze to Saturday, the sun makes its confident return, warming the earth with rays that will reach up to seventy degrees, before casting a softer, cooler atmosphere in the afternoon shadows. A playful breeze, gusting here and there, will add a buoyant touch to the day, encouraging one to step outside and revel in the beauty of the moment. With the visibility clear and welcoming, it would be a splendid time to don light layers—a simple shirt paired with a lightweight jacket will suit the fluctuating temperatures. Perhaps a meandering stroll through Golden Gate Park or a leisurely coffee at a sidewalk café would bring a comforting joy, as the mélange of nature and urban life intertwines beautifully in this captivating city.
